Dear Ms. Gordy:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violation identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective
action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, Area Manager, at 517-243-9743.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Initial evaluation
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12310
Section • (3) The agency shall assess all the following:
Description
• (a) The applicant or licensee's family and marital
status and history, including current and past level of
family functioning and relationships, and any
incidents of domestic violence, elder abuse, or child
abuse, as a perpetrator.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged that a registered sex offender is living in the foster
home and the agency failed to follow up with this concern.
Investigation The Chief Administrator was notified of the allegation via
telephone on 05/17/2024. The Chief Administrator reported there
was no evidence the biological son of Relative 1, who is listed on
the sexual offender registry, was residing in the home of Relative
1 where foster children reside. The foster children are the
biological children of Relative 1’s son, hereafter referred to as
Biological Father. The Chief Administrator reported Biological
Father is homeless and has listed his address as the address of
Relative 1. The Chief Administrator referred me to the Licensing
Supervisor and Staff 1 for further information.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 06/14/2024 and 07/17/2024 via
telephone. Staff 1 is the licensing worker for the agency. Staff 1
reported she has interviewed all children residing in the home of
Relative 1 and the children denied that their Biological Father has
resided in the home with them. Staff 1 reported she initiated
special evaluation #2024SEC0001620 on 05/20/2024 to address
the allegation the Biological Father was residing in Relative 1’s
home. Staff 1 reported the evaluation is still open and thus far
there is no evidence the Biological Father is residing in the home
of Relative 1.
During the interview on 07/17/2024 Staff 1 reported she had
completed the DHS-3130 home study for Relative 1 on
01/30/2024 and at the time she did not know of the concern
Biological Father may have been residing in the home of Relative
1. Staff 1 reported she was unaware Biological Father was listed
2

as a sexual offender and therefore the home study did not
address this concern.
Staff 1 reported she was aware of a DHS-3130-A that was
completed on 02/22/2024 for Relative 1. Staff 1 reported this
home study was completed by the foster care worker for the home
who no longer is employed by the agency.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 06/17/2024 via telephone. Staff 2 is
the foster care worker for Relative 1’s home and the children on
the case. Staff 2 reported there is no evidence Biological Father
has been residing in the home. Staff 2 reported the foster children
have not reported that their father is residing in the home. Staff 2
further reported Relative 1 has not reported that Biological Father
has or is residing in the home.
Relative 1 was interviewed via telephone on 07/03/2024.
Relative 1 denied that Biological Father, had been residing in the
home. Relative 1 reported Biological Father “couch surfs” living
here and there with no fixed address.
Foster Youth A was interviewed via telephone on 07/03/2024.
Foster Youth A. Foster Youth A denied Biological Father lives in
the home of Relative 1 where he himself resides. Foster Youth A
reports he feels safe living in Relative 1’s home.
The Licensing Supervisor was interviewed via telephone on
07/17/2024. The Licensing Supervisor acknowledged the agency
did have information prior to the home study being completed as
the Biological Father’s address was listed as the address of
Relative 1. The Licensing Supervisor reported she missed this
information in CWLM. The “PSOR” public offender registration,
indicated Biological Father’s address is the same as Relative 1.
The Licensing Supervisor acknowledged this information was
overlooked therefore the home study did not address the concern.
Biological Father’s whereabouts are unknown and thus, was
unable to be interviewed.
DOCUMENTATION REVIEW:
• Review in CWLM of Relative 1’s file (unlicensed
relative). The file documents that DCWL Analyst in Lansing
identified on 11/15/2023 the Biological Fathers address
was listed as the address of Relative 1. This information
was obtained from the PSOR document. The box is
3

checked for “address” indicating the Biological Father is
living at Relative 1’s home.
• Relative 1’s Initial Home Study was completed on
11/16/2023. The home study, (DHS-3130) was reviewed.
The Home study does not address the concern Biological
Father may be living in the home of Relative 1.
• A DHS-3130-A home study dated 02/22/2024 was
reviewed. The home study does not address that the
PSOR indicated the Biological Father’s address is the
same as Relative 1.
• Social Work Contacts were reviewed. A social work
contact dated 02/16/2024, written by Staff 2, documents an
FTM was conducted on this date. The contact states both,
the Biological Mother and Biological Father have been
living in the home, but does not clearly identify the home of
Relative 1. The contact further states the parents living in
the home are not permitted. The contact proceeds with a
safety plan prohibiting the Biological Father from living in
the home or staying overnight in the home of Relative 1.
• PSOR Document: The document was reviewed and
identifies the Biological Father as a registered sex offender
whose address is the same as Relative 1.
Analysis A sexual offender registry check conducted on 11/15/2023 by a
DCWL Analyst in Lansing identified that The Biological Father’s
address is the same as Relative 1. The PSOR was uploaded into
the CWLM system on the same date. The agency failed to identify
this information during the process of licensing the home. The
DHS-3130 did not address the PSOR finding.
The DHS 3130-A also did not address the concern noted on the
PSOR. The FTM on 02/16/2023 noted that the Biological Father
may have been living in the home and a safety plan was initiated.
Conclusion Violation Established
4

Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan the recommendation is for
continuance of the regular license.
